bibl.title: Letter from R.A. Watson to Mabel H. Lazear, April 24, 1907

div1.p: Watson writes about work to increase Mabel Lazear's pension.

div1.head: Letter from R.A. Watson to Mabel H. Lazear, April 24, 1907
div1.opener:
FRAME & CO.
______
Telegraphic Addresses:
“ADVANCE, NEW YORK, ”
“FRAMEZZO, LONDON,”
A. B. C. Al & Lieber's Codes Used.
_______
ALSO AT
21 MINCING LANE, LONDON, E. C.
90-96 Wall Street,
New York24th April 1907
Dear Madame,
div1.p:
I have your letter
of April 14th and have conveyed
contents of same to our
Association, and I trust a
proper recognition of your
husbands great work for
humanity, will be in evidence
as soon as possible, in
the shape of an adequate
pension for yourself & family.
It may possibly take some
little time to bring this
about, but you can depend
on all efforts being made
that can.
